intro: Anomalanthus collinus, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red and purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Anomalanthus collinus is drought-tolerant and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
